titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 1322: Ledger of Medici accounts

notesStmt.note: Forms part of: Gondi-Medici Business Records.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Ledger of accounts of Luigi and Alamanno de' Medici, for the years 1495-1544. Includes a detailed description of income and expenses which he incurred to manage his household. Also includes accounts of loans to members of aristocratic Florentine families, such as the Risaliti, the Salviati and the Strozzi; and accounts of small sales of textile products for private use. The accounts are kept using a single entry bookkeeping system. The book is mostly written by Luigi de' Medici himself, who signs numerous pages, but there are passages written by his son Alamanno, who took over his father's accounts once he died, in 1530.

supportDesc.extent: 100 leaves : 285 x 105 mm. bound to 290 x 112 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 100; 1-100; contemporary foliation in ink, upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 3 columns with vertical bounding lines in lead; the smaller column on the left with the transaction number, the large central column with a brief description of the transaction, and the smaller one on the right with its amount. In certain cases the large central column contains itemized accounts of a transaction within one entry.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script, perhaps by multiple hands, including those of Luigi and Alamanno de' Medici.

binding.p: Modern vellum. Previous binding had no. 165 on slip attached to spine (Zacour-Hirsch).
